comment: I struggled with the material all the way up till the midpoint, when I had to withdraw to avoid a fail. I sought help from him numerous times via zoom, email, in-class questions, and received little guidance and a bit of condescension when I was confused with the calcs - he insisted I should already understand the math and did little to encourage.

So he wasnt horrible, he was passionate about teaching. But for some reason(he was puzzled too) our class didnt do too well in this class. He is very insistent on attending all lectures and gets huffy if you get late or skip any. Participation does matter if u wanna be on his good side, he doesnt like people who dont seem to pay attention in class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. A really is an awesome lab professor. His labs correlate exactly to what we were learning in class, making the content unbelievably easy to understand. Really charismatic guy, and lays out exactly what you need to do to get an A. Lab grading can be a bit tough, but he drops the lowest grade.

Great teacher, really knowledgeable of the subject. show up to every class and do the homework. put up the effort and you'll pass his class. he tell you what you need to focus on when it come to the test. His recitations help a lot.

Awesome teacher. Took him for physcis 1 during the summer. Usually classes are harder during the summer and he understood that, so he gives a lot of partial credit on tests. Goes into detail of the subject and even answers the stupid questions people are afraid to ask.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: I took Dr. A over the summer and I was concerned that I wouldnt make it out of the class with a good grade but Dr. A is the best choice I could have made. All his tests are an hour long and he goes over every answer that will be on the test to make sure you understand the concept and all the free response come directly from the recitation problems.

Best physics teacher out there!! Every lecture was engaging and the concepts were explained thoroughly and the practice problems done in class are the EXACT ones on the exam! After every test, he makes sure you understand what you did wrong and then explains the concepts again all without shaming/demeaning you. Super approachable guy-- love him!

You cannot use excel to make your graphs. Your work should be done a certain way. I understood that there was a proper way to do things. The only problem I had was that he required that there was less than 5% error on labs or else he took points off. That is extremely hard to accomplish as a human. Tough A compared to any other Physics one lab.

This professor is great. He is funny and helpful. If you participate in class and know answers to questions that no one else does, he will give you bonus points on your test. He knew the names and faces of all of his students. In fact, he realized that some people not from our class were sitting there, and he politely asked them to leave! 10/10

He's amazing, by far my favorite prof. He basically tells you what's going to be on the test. He does have some trick questions, but if you pay attention in class, he usually harps on them. He loves his students and makes his lectures entertaining. Would def take him again.

Dr. Acharya is one of the best professors out there. He does his best to ensure that you will get a good grade. During class he solves plenty of examples for students to understand the concepts. Tells you what will possibly be on tests from the recitation or ppts. Go to all recitations, study the ppts, and pay attention. This class is worth taking.

I studied the recitations and practice problems(try to understand the concept, not the specific question). He tells what questions will be on the test in class. These made me do well. An A is very possible in this class, but it won't be handed to you. He grades things as soon as possible and is very accessible(Office hours, email, etc). Take him.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: PAY ATTENTION. He will do everything he can to try and help you get the grade you want, but you have to show that you care for the class. If you do, he'll bump your grade up in the end! His tests are a breeze if you PAY ATTENTION/ATTEND recitation and do the practice problems. He literally takes a few questions from those and puts them in the test.

This class was hard for me, so this review may be more negative than it should be, but aside from that class was rough. Lectures were detailed and fast overall, made material hard to follow, but Dr. A was funny enough to help us get through it. Tests and homework were insanely hard, barely passed the course. Be wary of what you are signing up for.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: He means well but he expects you to understand the material through his lecture of reading the powerpoint. You only have homework, recitation, tests and a final. Brand new to KSU this semester so tried to do everything by the book
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Prof. Acharya is one of the best professor. He cares about students' grade. There will be a lot of homework in Webassign every week. However, if you know how to do all the homework problems and his ppt, you will definitely do well on the test. He will tell some test questions in the class. Pay Attention. If you work hard, it will pay off in the end
